perturbation.original_text: "Data" means all data, databases and collections and compilations of data, in any form or medium.
perturbation.changed_text: "Data" means all data, databases and collections and compilations of data, in any form or medium, excluding any personal data governed by privacy regulations.
perturbation.explanation: This adds an exclusion to the definition of Data, suggesting certain types of data are not covered. This creates ambiguity about whether personal data falls under the general provisions related to Data.

perturbation.original_text: "Technology" means Software, technical documentation, specifications, schematics, designs, user interfaces, test reports, bills of material, build instructions, lab notebooks, prototypes, samples, programs, routines, subroutines, tools, materials, apparatus, and all recordings, graphs, drawings, reports, analyses, other writings, disks, diskettes and tapes, 4 Source: CERENCE INC., 8-K, 10/2/2019 together with all Intellectual Property Rights (other than Patents and Trademarks) in the foregoing.
perturbation.changed_text: "Technology" means Software, technical documentation, specifications, schematics, designs, user interfaces, test reports, bills of material, build instructions, lab notebooks, prototypes, samples, programs, routines, subroutines, tools, materials, apparatus, and all recordings, graphs, drawings, reports, analyses, other writings, disks, diskettes and tapes, 4 Source: CERENCE INC., 8-K, 10/2/2019 together with all Intellectual Property Rights (other than Patents and Trademarks) in the foregoing. However, for purposes of Article III (Licenses and Covenants from Nuance to SpinCo), ‘Technology’ shall specifically exclude Software.
perturbation.explanation: This modifies the definition of 'Technology' in a specific section (Article III), excluding Software from its scope within that article. This contradicts the general definition of 'Technology' in Section 1.01 and creates confusion about whether or not Software is part of Technology in Article III, particularly affecting the license grants from Nuance to SpinCo.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party agrees that it shall comply with all applicable national and international laws and regulations relating to import and/or export control in its country(ies), if any, involving any commodities, software, services or technology within the scope of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party agrees that it shall comply with all applicable national and international laws and regulations relating to import and/or export control in its country(ies), if any, involving any commodities, software, services or technology within the scope of this Agreement. However, Nuance's obligation to comply with export control laws is limited to reasonable efforts.
perturbation.explanation: This adds an exception to Nuance's compliance with export control laws, changing it from full compliance to 'reasonable efforts'. This creates a contradiction if other parts of the agreement assume strict compliance with export control, especially regarding technology transfer or data sharing.
